contents.content: In case your Security Mentor is known, refer to the information security department
Test weird case where background color is not properly removed
Security Mentor is supposed to coordinate all security tasks. Testing updates available.

name: LC-02
description: Plan relevant security trainings for the project team.

contents.content: Security Mentor can use the reporting function of the Training Tool in order to verify whether the team members have attended the relevant security trainings.
Ensure that project members have an appropriate security know - how helping to protect our systems against attacks.

name: SA-01
description: 3rd party code is identified, checked for security vulnerabilities and its update process is defined.

contents.content:
Implementation of automated tooling can support this task:
- https: //www.owasp.org/index.php/OWASP_Dependency_Check (mapping of dependencies to CVEs)
- https: //nodesecurity.io/tools (evaluation of vulnerable packages for npm)
- http: //retirejs.github.io/retire.js/ (JavaScript libraries with known vulnerabilites)

name: SA-02
description: No fundamentally different roles are present in the same application.

contents.content: internal employees and external customers should work on completely separated systems so that the privilege escalation probability and impact in case of a DoS attack are mitigated.

name: AU-01
description: Operate all authentication controls on a trusted system

contents.content: Do not perform any authentication decisions on the client side (browser, mobile app, ...)

name: AU-02
description: Users must re-authenticate prior to performing security critical operations.

contents.content:
To the security critical actions usually belongs:

- changing of password
- changing of other personal data (e.g. e-mail address, contact data...)

- usage of particular enhanced rights if these are defined

Reauthentication can happen e.g. by input of password, second factor or both.
